case_vignette: a 55-year-old black man presents for evaluation of fine wrinkles that had developed over the past year. physical examination reveals diffuse areas offine wrinkling that run parallel to lines of cleavage on his neck, chest, axilla, trunk, back, and upper arms bilaterally. the affected skin has normal pigmentation and lacks erythema, induration, and atrophy. lateral tension obliterates the wrinkling. the patient never notes any inflammation, itching, or pain. there are no signs or symptoms of systemic involvement. he denies sunbathing and denies any history of skin disorders or other significant health problems.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm here because I have developed fine wrinkles over the past year on my neck, chest, axilla, trunk, back, and upper arms.
Have you noticed any changes in the texture or thickness of your skin in these areas?
No, the affected skin has normal pigmentation and no signs of thickening or hardening.
Do you have any other symptoms such as muscle weakness, trouble swallowing, or gastrointestinal issues?
No, I don't have any signs or symptoms of systemic involvement.
Do you have any history of prolonged use of topical steroids or other similar medications?
No, I don't have any history of using topical steroids or similar medications.
Is there any family history of similar skin conditions or genetic diseases?
I deny any history of skin disorders or other significant health problems, including in my family.
Have you experienced any significant weight loss or changes in your diet or lifestyle in the past year?
No, I haven't experienced any significant weight loss or changes in my diet or lifestyle.
Final Diagnosis: Cutis Laxa
